babysign-car.description: The camera finally caught his baby sign for "car":  two hands turning a phantom steering wheel.  See the car in the book?  In the last few weeks, Felix has started diligently naming/signing things when he sees them, as a sort of conversational technique.  Before, he would usually only communicate when he wanted something.
babysign-car.title: Babysign Car

bottle.description: The end of an era:  Felix no longer lets us hold his bottle.  At least he likes to sit in our lap while drinking it, but even that is not necessary.  Dean and Lucie are becoming obsolete.
bottle.title: Bottle

forest1.description: A gorgeous day out for Forrest Jones's two year birthday party.
forest1.title: Forest 1

forest4.description: Why hit a stupid bird when Dad reacts so nicely?
forest4.title: Forest 4

pool1.description: Keith and Beth (the landlords) are about to landscape the backyard.  They de-weeded the yard and discovered it was ONLY weeds.
pool1.title: Pool 1

sleepover1.description: Felix invited Ezekiel for a sleepover.  There was much tounge waggling.
sleepover1.title: Sleepover 1

sleepover2.description: Felix and Ezekiel after a few rounds of spin the bottle.
sleepover2.title: Sleepover 2

teaparty1.description: A teaparty, featuring:  Clifford the dog, Cookie Monster, Albert the monkey, Madamoiselle Vera the pig, Potama the hippo, and Maurice the rat.
teaparty1.title: Teaparty 1

teaparty4.description: In the end, emotions ran perhaps too high and the teaparty took an unfortunate, sinister turn.  Mistakes were made.  Poor Maurice's whereabouts are still unknown.
teaparty4.title: Teaparty 4

description:
Felix is finally fun enough that Dean doesn't think he needs to grow up anymore; he can stay 17 months old as long as he wants.

New words:

  • bébé: baby, in French.
  • [tilting his head to the side]: sleepy, asleep. We've been doing this sign (+ hands together like a pillow) when it's time to go to sleep. He has not used it to tell us he is sleepy yet (we wish!), but he used it a couple of times to describe someone in bed, in a book.
title: May 18
